Column Comment.0: ADDITIVE GROUP IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for an additive group. Additivegroups may be created to associate additives with similar function, or that areprohibited for use in a particular jurisdiction.
Column Comment.1: CATALOGUE ADDITIVE TYPE: A material added to a fluid to perform one or morespecific functions, such as a weighting agent, viscosifier or lubricant. (SchlumbergerOilfield Glossary). Note that the function of this table may also be assumed by theCLASSIFICATION module for more robust and complete classifications.
Column Comment.2: ADDITIVE PART OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique sequencer so that multipleadditives of the same type may be added to a group. Allows implementations tocapture more than one specific catalogue additive of a type, if known.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: CATALOGUE ADDITIVE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the list of kinds ofadditives. Think of this table as a catalogue of all the kinds of additives that can bepurchased or created. Use this column if the specific catalogue number is known.
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.7: LONG NAME: Common long name used for the Catalogue Group Part.
Column Comment.8: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL shouldbe created.
Column Comment.9: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data
Column Comment.10: SHORT NAME: Common short name used for the Catalogue Group Part.
Column Comment.11: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.12: SOURCE DOCUMENT: The literature reference for the information about thesubstance in this row.
Column Comment.13: SUBSTANCE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a substance that can be describedeither chemically or in terms of composition. Elements, ions, isotopes, isomers,minerals, chemicals, solvents, production substances, hydrocarbons etc are alllisted.Be advised that many applications and agencies may use the same term, but thedefinition and composition details may not be the same. Use the SUBSTANCE XREFtable to capture relationships between substances, such as similar substances.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.ho lastchanged the row.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
